availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Nelson County, Kentucky, attorney. Indiana native. Married to Mary E. Wickliffe in December 1852. Father of Nathaniel Muir, Willie Muir, Halstead Muir, Jasper Muir, and Charles Muir. Farmer in Nelson County in 1850. Attorney in Nelson County in 1860. Commissioned as a notary public for Nelson County on February 5, 1861. Owned seven enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, p. 324A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p. 181.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p. 109B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, Bardstown, p. 72B.
Kentucky, County Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Film # 000481509, Nelson County, December 14, 1842 (accessed via ancestry.com).
Kentucky, Birth Records, 1847-1911, Nelson County, March 13, 1855, p. 3 (accessed via ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "Jasper W. Muir Sr (1828-1907)," Memorial #100680547, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/100680547/jasper-w-muir (accessed February 6, 2019).
